alert.note: Alert for Navajo (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 10 at 5:16PM MST until September 10 at 8:15PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Navajo County in north central Arizona... * Until 815 PM MST /915 PM MDT/. * At 514 PM MST /614 PM MDT/, National Weather Service Flagstaff Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain near Castle Butte, south of Dilkon. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Castle Butte, Dilkon, Cedar Springs, Tees Toh and Seba Dalkai. This includes the following highways... State Route 87 between mile markers 361 and 390. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Jeddito Wash, Cottonwood Wash, Pueblo Colorado Wash, Ha-whi-yalin Wash, Little Colorado River, Humpy Wash, Fern Feather Wash, Tees Toh Wash and Coyote Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
